// This JSON hardware definition file specifies peripheral pinouts
// of the Rev.2 Avnet MT3620 Starter Kit (SK2). The Rev.2 board can
// be fitted with an Ethernet Click, it also allows reconfiguration
// of Click2, Pmod and Grove connectors, by moving config resistors.
// See Hardware User Guide (pages 22-26) for more details.
// http://avnet.me/mt3620-kit-UG-V2
// ISU1 maps to Click socket #2. It can be configured to support
// either a 4-wire UART (default) or an SPI interface.
// UART configuration (default) has R59 and R60 populated with
// zero ohm resistors (and R61 and R62 unpopulated).
// SPI configuration requires de-populating R59 and R60, then
// moving these config resistors to locations R61 and R62.
// ISU1 maps also to the PMOD connector (unpopulated). It's default
// configuration supports type 4A UART Pmod peripheral boards for
// BLE or wired UART expansion. Alternatively it can be configured
// to support type 2A SPI Pmod peripheral boards.
// UART configuration (default) has R39 and R50 populated with
// zero ohm resistors (and locations R41 and R52 unpopulated).
// SPI configuration requires de-populating R39 and R50, then
// moving these config resistors to locations R41 and R52.
// ISU2 maps to the Grove connector. It's default configuration
// supports I2C Grove boards. Alternatively it provides a way to
// access a third UART / connection with UART Grove boards
// I2C configuration has R57, R53 and R55 populated with zero ohm
// resistors (and locations R54 and R56 unpopulated).
// UART configuration requires de-populating R57, R53 and R55, then
// fitting zero ohm resistors to locations R54 and R56
// Note! If the Grove connector is reconfigured for UART mode (TX, RX)
// then ISU2 based I2C bus to onboard sensors, OLED display and
// Click sockets will no longer be available
// See Hardware User Guide (page 26) for more details
// http://avnet.me/mt3620-kit-UG-V2

Peripherals.Name: AVNET_MT3620_SK_APP_STATUS_LED_YELLOW
Peripherals.Comment: Application status LED uses GPIO4.

Peripherals.Name: AVNET_MT3620_SK_WLAN_STATUS_LED_YELLOW
Peripherals.Comment: GPIO drives WLAN status LED and is also exposed on CLICK1 (PWM)

Peripherals.Name: AVNET_MT3620_SK_USER_LED_RED
Peripherals.Comment: User LED Red channel uses GPIO8.

Peripherals.Name: AVNET_MT3620_SK_USER_LED_GREEN
Peripherals.Comment: User LED Green channel uses GPIO9.

Peripherals.Name: AVNET_MT3620_SK_USER_LED_BLUE
Peripherals.Comment: User LED Blue channel uses GPIO10.

Peripherals.Name: AVNET_MT3620_SK_USER_BUTTON_A
Peripherals.Comment: User BUTTON A uses GPIO12.

Peripherals.Name: AVNET_MT3620_SK_USER_BUTTON_B
Peripherals.Comment: User BUTTON B uses GPIO13.

Peripherals.Name: AVNET_MT3620_SK_GPIO42
Peripherals.Comment: GPIO42 is exposed on CLICK1 (AN).

Peripherals.Name: AVNET_MT3620_SK_GPIO43
Peripherals.Comment: GPIO43 is exposed on CLICK2 (AN).

Peripherals.Name: AVNET_MT3620_SK_GPIO34
Peripherals.Comment: GPIO34 is exposed on CLICK2 (INT) and PMOD (Pin 1).

Peripherals.Name: AVNET_MT3620_SK_GPIO35
Peripherals.Comment: GPIO35 is exposed on CLICK2 (RST) and PMOD (Pin 8).

Peripherals.Name: AVNET_MT3620_SK_GPIO31
Peripherals.Comment: GPIO31 is exposed twice on CLICK2 (SCK) and (TX) and PMOD (Pin 2).

Peripherals.Name: AVNET_MT3620_SK_GPIO33
Peripherals.Comment: GPIO33 is exposed twice on CLICK2 (SD0) and (RX) and PMOD (Pin 3).

Peripherals.Name: AVNET_MT3620_SK_GPIO32
Peripherals.Comment: GPIO32 is exposed on CLICK2 (SDI) and PMOD (Pin 4).

Peripherals.Name: AVNET_MT3620_SK_GPIO0
Peripherals.Comment: GPIO0 is exposed on CLICK1 (PWM) and drives the WLAN LED.

Peripherals.Name: AVNET_MT3620_SK_GPIO1
Peripherals.Comment: GPIO1 is exposed on CLICK2 (PWM) and PMOD (Pin 9).

Peripherals.Name: AVNET_MT3620_SK_GPIO2
Peripherals.Comment: GPIO2 is exposed on CLICK1 (RST).

Peripherals.Name: AVNET_MT3620_SK_GPIO5
Peripherals.Comment: GPIO5 is exposed on CLICK1 (INT).

Peripherals.Name: AVNET_MT3620_SK_GPIO28
Peripherals.Comment: GPIO28 is exposed twice on CLICK1 (SDI) and (RX).

Peripherals.Name: AVNET_MT3620_SK_GPIO26
Peripherals.Comment: GPIO26 is exposed twice on CLICK1. (SCK) and (TX)

Peripherals.Name: AVNET_MT3620_SK_GPIO37
Peripherals.Comment: GPIO37 is exposed on CLICK1 (SCL), CLICK2 (SCL), GROVE Connector (Pin 1), and OLED Display Connector (Pin 3).

Peripherals.Name: AVNET_MT3620_SK_GPIO38
Peripherals.Comment: GPIO38 is exposed on CLICK1 (SDA), CLICK2 (SDA), GROVE Connector (Pin 2),and OLED Display Connector (Pin 4).

Peripherals.Name: AVNET_MT3620_SK_GPIO39
Peripherals.Comment: GPIO39 is exposed on PMOD (Pin 7).

Peripherals.Name: AVNET_MT3620_SK_GPIO29
Peripherals.Comment: GPIO29 is exposed on CLICK1 (CS)

Peripherals.Name: AVNET_MT3620_SK_GPIO27
Peripherals.Comment: GPIO27 is exposed on CLICK1 (SDI)

Peripherals.Name: AVNET_MT3620_SK_PWM_CONTROLLER0
Peripherals.Comment: PWM CONTROLLER 0: channel 0 is exposed on CLICK1 (PWM), channel 1 is exposed on: CLICK2 (PWM) and PMOD (Pin 9), channel 2 is exposed on: CLICK1 (INT), CLICK2 (INT) and PMOD (Pin 7).  Pins for this controller are shared with AVNET_MT3620_SK_GPIO0, AVNET_MT3620_SK_GPIO1 and AVNET_MT3620_SK_GPIO2. If this PWM controller is requested, none of these GPIOs can be used.

Peripherals.Name: AVNET_MT3620_SK_PWM_CONTROLLER1
Peripherals.Comment: PWM CONTROLLER 1: channel 0 is used by Application Status LED, and channel 1 is used by WLAN status LED. Pins for this controller are shared with AVNET_MT3620_SK_APP_STATUS_LED_YELLOW and AVNET_MT3620_SK_WLAN_STATUS_LED_YELLOW. If this PWM controller is requested, none of these GPIOs can be used.

Peripherals.Name: AVNET_MT3620_SK_PWM_CONTROLLER2
Peripherals.Comment: PWM CONTROLLER 2: channel 0 is used by User LED Red, channel 1 is used by User LED Green, channel 2 is used by User LED Blue. Pins for this controller are shared with AVNET_MT3620_SK_USER_LED_RED, AVNET_MT3620_SK_USER_LED_GREEN, and AVNET_MT3620_SK_USER_LED_BLUE. If this PWM controller is requested, none of these GPIOs can be used.

Peripherals.Name: AVNET_MT3620_SK_ADC_CONTROLLER0
Peripherals.Comment: ADC CONTROLLER 0: channel 0 is used by Ambient Light Sensor, channel 1 is exposed on CLICK1 (AN), channel 2 is exposed on CLICK2 (AN). Pins for this controller are shared with AVNET_MT3620_SK_GPIO42 and AVNET_MT3620_SK_GPIO43. If this ADC controller is requested, none of these GPIOs can be used.

Peripherals.Name: AVNET_MT3620_SK_ISU0_UART
Peripherals.Comment: ISU0 UART is exposed on CLICK1.

Peripherals.Name: AVNET_MT3620_SK_ISU0_SPI
Peripherals.Comment: ISU0 SPI is exposed on CLICK1).

Peripherals.Name: AVNET_MT3620_SK_ISU1_UART
Peripherals.Comment: ISU1 UART is exposed on CLICK2 and PMOD.

Peripherals.Name: AVNET_MT3620_SK_ISU1_SPI_CONFIGURABLE_CLICK2
Peripherals.Comment: ISU1 SPI is exposed on CLICK2 when R59, R60, R61 and R62 are modified.  See HW User Guide.

Peripherals.Name: AVNET_MT3620_SK_ISU1_SPI_CONFIGURABLE_PMOD
Peripherals.Comment: ISU1 SPI is exposed on (PMOD) when R39, R50, R41 and R52 are modified.  See HW User Guide.

Peripherals.Name: AVNET_MT3620_SK_ISU2_UART_CONFIGURABLE_GROVE
Peripherals.Comment: ISU2 UART is also exposed on the Grove connector when Resistor locations R53, R54, R55, R56 and R57 are modified. See HW User Guide.

Peripherals.Name: AVNET_MT3620_SK_ISU2_I2C
Peripherals.Comment: ISU2 I2C is shared between on-device sensors, GROVE Connector, OLED DISPLAY Connector, CLICK1, and CLICK2.
